lang.name: en_CA
lang.key: Maintained by Madison Kelly (mkelly@alteeve.ca) for the local hardware Scan Agent.
Hardware sensor data read from sources local to the host system.
Starting to read the hardware data for: [#!variable!machine!#]

The CPU, RAM and LED (if possible) has been recorded; - CPU Model: ... [#!variable!cpu_model!#] - Total Cores: . [#!variable!total_cores!#] - Total Threads: [#!variable!total_threads!#] - CPU Bugs: .... [#!variable!cpu_bugs!#] - CPU Flags: ... [#!variable!cpu_flags!#] - ID LED state: [#!variable!id_led!#] - CSS LED: ..... [#!variable!css_led!#] (CSS = Customer Self-Service) - Error LED: ... [#!variable!error_led!#] - Total RAM: ... [#!variable!ram_total_size!#] - Usable RAM: .. [#!variable!ram_memory_total!#] (Available to the OS) - Free Memory: . [#!variable!ram_memory_free!#] - Total swap: .. [#!variable!ram_swap_total!#] - Free swap: ... [#!variable!ram_swap_free!#]
The amount of swap used has risen above: [#!data!scan-hardware::swap::high!#%]. It is now using: [#!variable!swap_used_percent!#%] of a total: [#!variable!swap_total!#] available.
The amount of swap used has dropped below: [#!data!scan-hardware::swap::low!#%]. It is now using: [#!variable!swap_used_percent!#%] of a total: [#!variable!swap_total!#] available.

Either the CPU, RAM and LED information has changed. This generally shouldn't happen; - CPU Model: ... [#!variable!old_cpu_model!#] -> [#!variable!new_cpu_model!#] - Total Cores: . [#!variable!old_total_cores!#] -> [#!variable!new_total_cores!#] - Total Threads: [#!variable!old_total_threads!#] -> [#!variable!new_total_threads!#] - CPU Bugs: .... [#!variable!old_cpu_bugs!#] -> [#!variable!new_cpu_bugs!#] - CPU Flags: ... [#!variable!old_cpu_flags!#] -> [#!variable!new_cpu_flags!#] - ID LED state: [#!variable!old_id_led!#] -> [#!variable!new_id_led!#] - CSS LED: ..... [#!variable!old_css_led!#] -> [#!variable!new_css_led!#] (CSS = Customer Self-Service) - Error LED: ... [#!variable!old_error_led!#] -> [#!variable!new_error_led!#] - Total RAM: ... [#!variable!old_ram_total_size!#] -> [#!variable!new_ram_total_size!#] - Usable RAM: .. [#!variable!old_ram_memory_total!#] -> [#!variable!new_ram_memory_total!#] (Available to the OS) - Free Memory: . [#!variable!old_ram_memory_free!#] -> [#!variable!new_ram_memory_free!#] - Total swap: .. [#!variable!old_ram_swap_total!#] -> [#!variable!new_ram_swap_total!#] - Free swap: ... [#!variable!old_ram_swap_free!#] -> [#!variable!new_ram_swap_free!#]

A new RAM memory module has been found; - Locator: ..... [#!variable!locator!#] - Size: ........ [#!variable!size!#] - Manufacturer: [#!variable!manufacturer!#] - Model: ....... [#!variable!model!#] - Serial Number: [#!variable!serial_number!#]

Something about the RAM module [#!variable!locator!#] has changed. This shouldn't normally happen. Was the RAM module replaced? - Size: ........ [#!variable!old_size!#] -> [#!variable!new_size!#] - Manufacturer: [#!variable!old_manufacturer!#] -> [#!variable!new_manufacturer!#] - Model: ....... [#!variable!old_model!#] -> [#!variable!new_model!#] - Serial Number: [#!variable!old_serial_number!#] -> [#!variable!new_serial_number!#]

The RAM module [#!variable!locator!#] has vanished! Was the module intentionally removed? If not, it may have failed. - Size: ........ [#!variable!old_size!#] - Manufacturer: [#!variable!old_manufacturer!#] - Model: ....... [#!variable!old_model!#] - Serial Number: [#!variable!old_serial_number!#]

The RAM module [#!variable!locator!#] has returned! - Size: ........ [#!variable!old_size!#] - Manufacturer: [#!variable!old_manufacturer!#] - Model: ....... [#!variable!old_model!#] - Serial Number: [#!variable!old_serial_number!#]

This node has: [#!variable!difference!#] less RAM than the peer node. If the RAM is being updated, this alert will clear once this node has been upgraded to have the same amount of RAM as the peer. If a memory module has failed, this warning will clear when the module has been replaced. - Local RAM: [#!variable!local_ram!#] - Peer's RAM: [#!variable!peer_ram!#]

This node and the peer node now have (nearly) the same amount of RAM, with a difference of: [#!variable!difference!#]. Clearing the previous alert and health warning. - Local RAM: [#!variable!local_ram!#] - Peer's RAM: [#!variable!peer_ram!#]

-=] IPMI Scan Agent
DESCRIPTION
This program is a "scan agent" for the ScanCore alert, monitoring and recovery tool for the Anvil! Intelligent Availabilityâ„¢ platform.
It monitors health of systems using tools locally available on most systems. Examples including information about memory available via /proc/meminfo and dmidecode, CPU data available via /proc/cpuinfo, etc.
VARIABLES
SWITCHES
-h, -?, --help
Show this dialog and exit.
--prep-db
If passed, the schema will be loaded into the database (if not already), even if no bonds are found. Note: This won't work if the agent has been manually disabled via 'scan-ipmitool::disable'.
SUPPORT
https://alteeve.com/w/Support
Alteeve's Niche!
